title: Karma prevents any sort of interaction in lane as well as dealing a ton of damage
body: My question is: when is she getting nerfed?

Not necessarily. A champion can have a poorly designed kit while also being weak.

Zed and Yasuo are both examples of that, actually. Their kits are extremely annoying to deal with and at times, are even unfair, however Zed has had a piss-poor win-rate for a long time and Yasuo players are renown for hard-feeding, because he's a difficult champion to play despite his kit. 

Poorly designed =\= strong, inherently.

But at the same time the kit could be poorly designed and be strong at the same time. Yas has been one of the most competitive camps for mid lane since his release, so has Zed. Even if they're annoying they're still strong. Zed can still kill his opponent with 1 play if he does everything right, so can  Yas. Yas has players that feed because he's hard to play, but remember when the Fiora rework came out! 10/10 players couldn't stop themselves from feeding. As for lose rates, Zed actual,y has counter play to him now, which is great, it just so happens that his counter picks are the meta right now. (I'd assume, not a mid player lol)

But look at Karma, she only gets really strong if built AP, and then it's a hit and miss. She only gets really annoying if you don't know how to beat her. But if you dodge every Q of hers she's useless.

Well as a mid laner, it's very hard to loose to Yasuo and Zed, you just have to play around them some classic counter's to them are Ahri, Lissandra and Lux. Sure yasuo has a wind wall but if he dashes at you, just CC him, it's simple, for zed his R will actually always make him appear behind you, so CC him. For karma and any other Utility mid Laner, you really should just play safe and try not to die because they deal extremely high damage with usually one ability (their only damaging ability usually) and more often then not just are really hard to kill whether it be because of a sheild or in Zilean's case his revive ultimate. And it becomes especially difficult as a melee mid laner, it's almost impossible to dodge karma or zilean's Q's with a melee mid laner because not only do both of them have really high range and large blast radius's, but CSing as a melee is very VERY difficult in the first place.

I'd argue that karma and other utility mids are just really solid picks if you want to not feed, sure you might not get a kill and you almost certainly won't get fed but you most likely will never loose lane with them. They are really powerful lane bullies.

I don't disagree with what you're saying, but how is Lux a counter to Yasuo and Zed? Yasuo can mitigate all of Lux's kit save for her R and the first pass of her W. A good player will know to Q behind when a Zed goes in so I accept that, but generally Zed is designed to counter and burst down immobile backline (which Lux is) and Yasuo is a skirmisher who relies on outplay to actually win. Ahri is a good counter to both (I like her as an anti-assassin champion) as is Lissandra (invulnerability+multiple CCs.) I just don't get why Lux is grouped with them.

Then again, I just pick Anivia into both and run exhaust to dumpster either one of them.

It's because she's easy and a solid pick against any mid laner, basically if your a good mid laner you should have no trouble against any match up with her since it's easy for her to counter play enemies, especially if the champion is hard to play because it's easier for them to mess up than for you. 

PS: I bait out the windwall, it's not to difficult to bait a yasuo into using it, especially pre 6 and they know that if they don't use it your E will hit them and do lots of damage too, so they don't have much of a choice but to use it against her due to her high damage and well she has very short cooldowns too so you don't have to worry to much about it baiting with your E(i max it first anyway)

Actually another one is Vlad but he got nerfed, your Q will have it's animation canceled but will do damage, it's kind of funny.

I gotchu. Windwall is absurd at level 1 and he maxes it last. I don't play Lux but her Q CD is likely a little over half of windwall so she'll have time to get a full combo off later?

RIP Vlad animation cancels.
If you land bind, he's dead as fuck.  If not, you're probably dead instead.  So it's like 50-50.

Hate to break it to you, but Lux gets demolished by assassins.  Yes, she's an easy, safe pick against MAGES.  But assassins destroy her.  Hilariously.  Even if you bait out WW, it's hard to tag Yasuo with a snare unless he dashes towards you.  And his DPS is insane compared to hers, so if you miss, you die.  Any Mage that has a skillshot as their only hard CC is not good against assassins.  Especially when it's a snare.  Also, Lux has very long base cooldowns.  They scale down quickly with level, and Lux stacks CDR, but early on her cooldowns are really long.  15 seconds on Q at rank 1, 10 seconds on E at all ranks.  Not to mention that max rank E costs 130 mana.  Which is more than her ult.

I'm not sure whether you are coming at this from the perspective of a mid laner or a support, but in either case, you are wrong.

Karma does not prevent interaction. Preventing interaction would be something like Morgana, whose Q and E are the definition of uninteractive. Every one of Karma's abilities can be played around. Her shield is weak early, on a long cooldown, and does nothing to prevent CC. Her Q is dodgable, and since its her only damage source you can always retaliate when she pokes. Her CC is after a long delay and requires her to close enough for you to do damage to her.

Her damage is also not that high. All of it is in Q, which while unempowered is just fairly average for a damaging ability, both in base damage and scaling, and which only has a miniscule AoE. Most of the bonus damage from RQ is loaded into the easily avoidable explosion.

I think a little clarity on her tether range would be a good start. Something similar to morgana's ult, because I'm sure I'm not the only one who has no clue how far I have to go to break it. I feel like all tethers should be like that, to where the caster and targets affected can see the tether range.

Karma's huge problem is that she can close gaps with her E and literally put you on a leash. If you can't escape from it, you're inevitably going to take massive burst damage from her Mantra-empowered Q both on bot lane and mid lane. Her kit builds up perfectly into one annoying "I will trade burst damage and you will barely trade anything because my shield blocks it" combination.

Are you talking about bot or mid? 

Because as a mid champ, she's safe, yes - but she doesn't nearly deal the same amount of damage as a proper mage. Her wave clear is okay, but not great. Her greatest utility is kite and reverse-engage, but she's nowhere near the level of Janna, Lulu, Zilean. Karma has good poke, but not as strong as Zyra's or Sona's. 

Karma's strength is that she's a generalist - can spend her ult to adapt to most situations - but I wouldn't say that she's an uninteractive character. Soraka is uninteractive because she eliminates trades. Karma not so.
